property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: Pakistani civilians collecting flood relief supplies

note.text: Corruption is common in Pakistan, especially because of the prevalence of poverty and economic instability. For example, unauthorized subcontracting is common practice among contractors in some areas. However, locals may not view such practices as corrupt.
In addition, humanitarian aid supplies are often stolen or sold illegally. Corruption among law enforcement officers is common as well.
To avoid the effects of corruption, be sure to document everything, involve as many locals as possible, and include both civilian and military representatives in the mission.
